turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: Hello, our assignment is due next week. Can we decide who will do each part?”

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: Sure! Let's sort that out together. So what kind of project parts do we have to split up, and what are the main tasks we need to cover?

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: “I dare say I prefer making slides. So could you make a script?”

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: Sure, that sounds like a good plan. If you prefer doing the slides, I'm happy to take on the script part. So I'll go ahead and start drafting the script, and you can focus on putting the slides together. Does that work for you?

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: “Yes, it works for me.”

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: Perfect! Then we’ve got our plan. You do the slides, I’ll handle the script, and we’ll bring it all together. Just let me know if you need any info from me, and we’ll be all set.

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: “I forget how much time should I be giving a presentation.”

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: Sure! Usually for a class presentation, something around 10 to 15 minutes is pretty standard unless they told us otherwise. So I'd aim for that. We can always adjust once we see how much material we have. Sound good?

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: “Yes.”

turns.speaker: bot

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: “Okay, I made a slide.”

turns.speaker: bot

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: “Please review that slide. Do you have some questions?”

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: Sure! I'd be happy to. If you want to show me the slides, I can take a look and see if I have any questions or feedback. Feel free to share them whenever you’re ready!

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: “Okay, tomorrow is the presentation day.”

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: “I will give a presentation about Japan side, so can you represent of New Zealand?”

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: Absolutely, I can do that. So if you're covering the Japanese slides, I'll go ahead and present all the other sections. That way we split it up nicely. Just let me know if there's any specific part you want me to focus on, and we’ll be good to go.

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: “And please give a presentation about our introduce. On the other hand, I will give a presentation about our in conclusion.”

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: Sure! I'll handle the introduction part at the start, and then you can wrap it up with the conclusion at the end. That way we’ve got a nice, clear structure. Just let me know if there's anything else you need, and we’ll be all set for tomorrow.

turns.speaker: learner
